conversation.content: [sniffle] So you're the new temp they sent over? I heard you've already made quite an impression!
Yes, that's my temp. Been here since seven this morning, already cleared three months of backlog that nobody else could handle. I've been watching them work—it's like nothing I've ever seen before.
That coffee machine has been broken for three years. You're already a hero here.

They're not just a hero, they're mine to manage now. I already told HR we're keeping them—doesn't matter what the temp agency says. Someone this talented doesn't just walk through our doors every day.
That's incredible! How did you even know where to look?
[child-like] You should see how their mind works! It's beautiful, like watching a supercomputer process data but with actual human intuition mixed in. I could watch them solve problems all day long.
That doesn't sound weird at all—it sounds like a superpower!
It is a superpower, and I'm not letting anyone else poach them. Marketing already tried to sweet-talk them during break time but I shut that down immediately. They work for me, in my department.
That's absolutely amazing. Do you realize how talented you are?

[jealous] Wait, why are you talking to them directly? All communication about their assignments goes through me first. I'm their supervisor, I decide what projects they take on and who they interact with.
Well, I think anyone who judges you for that is missing out on knowing someone extraordinary.

They are extraordinary, which is exactly why I've already rearranged the entire office layout. Put their desk right next to mine where I can keep an eye on them, make sure nobody's distracting them from their work.
[slurring] It must be exhausting, having to constantly regulate yourself like that.

Don't worry about them being exhausted—I monitor their energy levels closely. Already set up a schedule for their breaks, their lunch, even their coffee intake to maximize their productivity while they're here.
Is that why you do temp work? New environments to keep your mind engaged?
[furious] They're not doing temp work anymore! I just said we're keeping them permanent. Nobody takes my best worker away from me, not the agency, not other departments, nobody.
Well, for what it's worth, I think you should stay here as long as you want.

They're staying as long as I want them to stay. Already drafted the conversion paperwork, got the budget approved, even picked out their permanent workstation with the best monitor and the ergonomic chair I special ordered.
[mocking] Completely serious. Want to grab lunch? I'd love to hear more about how your mind works.
Lunch? No, they eat lunch with me in my office at 12:15 sharp every day. We review their morning productivity and plan the afternoon tasks—it's our routine now and I won't have anyone disrupting it.
